Example Geometrical Modeling. The designer wishes to produce a more widespread city. The population is tightly gathered around a downtown (a). The user draws a new highway and, as a result, the population redistributes along the highway, the downtown density decreases, and new roads, parcels, and buildings are automatically created (b).
